intro: Quercus insignis subsp. oocarpa, commonly known as the Oocarpa chinquapin, is a member of the Fagaceae family and is native to the highlands of Mexico. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree that typically grows in cloud forests at elevations between 1,800 and 3,000 meters. The plant is characterized by its alternate, ovate leaves with serrated margins and small, clustered flowers that develop into woody capsules containing edible seeds. Its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and ecological role in its native habitat. The species is also of interest for its potential in horticulture and conservation efforts.
